name: HttpResponse
comment:
An dart-io.HttpResponse represents the headers and data to be returned to a client in response to an HTTP request.

This object has a number of properties for setting up the HTTP header of the response. When the header has been set up the methods from the dart-io.IOSink can be used to write the actual body of the HTTP response. When one of the dart-io.IOSink methods is used for the first time the request header is send. Calling any methods that will change the header after it is sent will throw an exception.

When writing string data through the dart-io.IOSink the encoding used will be determined from the "charset" parameter of the "Content-Type" header.

HttpResponse response = ...
response.headers.contentType
    = new ContentType("application", "json", charset: "utf-8");
response.write(...);  // Strings written will be UTF-8 encoded.

If no charset is provided the default of ISO-8859-1 (Latin 1) will be used.

HttpResponse response = ...
response.headers.add(HttpHeaders.CONTENT_TYPE, "text/plain");
response.write(...);  // Strings written will be ISO-8859-1 encoded.

If an unsupported encoding is used an exception will be thrown if using one of the write methods taking a string.

contentLength.name: contentLength
contentLength.comment: Gets and sets the content length of the response. If the size of the response is not known in advance set the content length to -1 - which is also the default if not set.

statusCode.name: statusCode
statusCode.comment: Gets and sets the status code. Any integer value is accepted. For the official HTTP status codes use the fields from dart-io.HttpStatus. If no status code is explicitly set the default value dart-io.HttpStatus.OK is used.

reasonPhrase.name: reasonPhrase
reasonPhrase.comment: Gets and sets the reason phrase. If no reason phrase is explicitly set a default reason phrase is provided.

persistentConnection.name: persistentConnection
persistentConnection.comment: Gets and sets the persistent connection state. The initial value of this property is the persistent connection state from the request.

deadline.name: deadline
deadline.comment:
Set and get the dart-io.HttpResponse.deadline for the response. The deadline is timed from the time it's set. Setting a new deadline will override any previous deadline. When a deadline is exceeded, the response will be closed and any further data ignored.

To disable a deadline, set the dart-io.HttpResponse.deadline to null.

The dart-io.HttpResponse.deadline is null by default.

encoding.name: encoding
encoding.comment: The dart-convert.Encoding used when writing strings. Depending on the underlying consumer this property might be mutable.

cookies.name: cookies
cookies.comment: Cookies to set in the client (in the 'set-cookie' header).

connectionInfo.name: connectionInfo
connectionInfo.comment: Gets information about the client connection. Returns null if the socket is not available.

redirect.name: redirect
redirect.comment:
Respond with a redirect to dart-io.HttpResponse.redirect.location.

The URI in dart-io.HttpResponse.redirect.location should be absolute, but there are no checks to enforce that.

By default the HTTP status code HttpStatus.MOVED_TEMPORARILY (302) is used for the redirect, but an alternative one can be specified using the dart-io.HttpResponse.redirect.status argument.

This method will also call close, and the returned future is the furure returned by close.

detachSocket.name: detachSocket
detachSocket.comment:
Detaches the underlying socket from the HTTP server. When the socket is detached the HTTP server will no longer perform any operations on it.

This is normally used when a HTTP upgrade request is received and the communication should continue with a different protocol.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides dart-io.HttpResponse.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

done.name: done
done.comment: Get a future that will complete when all synchronous have completed, or an error happened. This future is identical to the future returned from close.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and dart-io.HttpResponse.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the dart-io.HttpResponse.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
dart-io.HttpResponse.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to dart-io.HttpResponse.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If dart-io.HttpResponse.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of dart-io.HttpResponse.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

write.name: write
write.comment: Converts dart-io.HttpResponse.write.obj to a String by invoking dart-io.HttpResponse.toString and adds the result to this.

writeAll.name: writeAll
writeAll.comment: Iterates over the given dart-io.HttpResponse.writeAll.objects and dart-io.HttpResponse.writes them in sequence.

writeln.name: writeln
writeln.comment: Converts dart-io.HttpResponse.writeln.obj to a String by invoking dart-io.HttpResponse.toString and adds the result to this, followed by a newline.

writeCharCode.name: writeCharCode
writeCharCode.comment:
Writes the dart-io.HttpResponse.writeCharCode.charCode to this.

This method is equivalent to write(new String.fromCharCode(charCode)).

add.name: add
add.comment: Writes the bytes uninterpreted to the consumer. While the call is synchronous, the data may be buffered until the underlying resource is ready. The data should not be modified after a call to dart-io.HttpResponse.add.

addStream.name: addStream
addStream.comment: Adds all elements of the given dart-io.HttpResponse.addStream.stream to this.

flush.name: flush
flush.comment:
Returns a dart-async.Future that completes once all buffered data is accepted by the to underlying dart-async.StreamConsumer.

It's an error to call this method, while an dart-io.HttpResponse.addStream is incomplete.

NOTE: This is not necessarily the same as the data being flushed by the operating system.
